channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for SC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for SC

item.title: Report X-2023090950
item.description:
Report X-2023090950

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-19T15:12:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-15
  • City: GREENVILLE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Container was loaded on an outbound trailer in the tail. Odor was later detected and leakage discovered. Ops Manager Matthew Davenport alerted QA over the radio. QA retrieved package, placed in a HazMat tub and brought to the QA Damaged HazMat cage. Spill was cleaned up. DescribePack: Appears the bottom seam of the jerrican failed and leaked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Jerrican was removed from trailer and placed in a plastic tote.

item.title: Report X-2023090937
item.description:
Report X-2023090937

  • City: COLUMBIA
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was discovered damaged by an admin, senior admin was alerted, package moved to hazmat cage in a lined bucket for further processing, DescribePack: loose caps DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in a lined hazmat container
